# ARFrame.WorldMappingStatus.mapped

**Case**

World tracking has adequately mapped the visible area.

## Declaration

```swift
case mapped
```

## Discussion

When the [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARFrame/worldMappingStatus-swift.property] of the session’s [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARSession/currentFrame] is [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARFrame/WorldMappingStatus-swift.enum/mapped], the session has produced a high-fidelity internal map of the real-world space around the device’s current position and the scene visible to the camera.

This status provides the highest reliability for relocalizing to a saved world map, provided that:

1. You call [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARSession/getCurrentWorldMap(completionHandler:)] to save the world map while the status of the [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARSession/currentFrame] is [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARFrame/WorldMappingStatus-swift.enum/mapped].
2. When you run a new session (later or on another device) from that [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARWorldMap], the device running the new session is at a real-world position and orientation similar to that when the world map was saved.
title: ARFrame.WorldMappingStatus.mapped
